topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54dec7856368722bc4672600#post_54dec7856368722bc4672600
[bq="Thanotos Omega"]"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54dec6e96368722ea35d0400#post_54dec6e96368722ea35d0400
Alrighty then,

You know a show i respect? Lucky Star, that show had 4 Naked teenage girls washing together and never once felt fansercicy about it, just did it's thing as usual,[/bq]
Not a huge fan of Lucky Star either but that's for different reasons, I just believe everything they do, Nichijou does better +*but again that's just me so I'm fine with it if you absolutely love Lucky Star*+

But I definitely agree, there are some subjects such as nudity that can be done well in anime without having to resort to making them extremely fanservice-y

One scene that comes to mind is from the aforementioned Nichijou
!http://i2.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/847/621/556.gif!
Absolutely nothing fanservice-y about this scene, yet they're very obviously naked

But recently I saw My Neighbor Totoro, which I'll also use as an example because I think it handles the nudity subject even BETTER. There's a scene where the family is all taking a bath together, the father and his two daughters. The girls are even _outside the tub, *no clothes,*_ yet they manage to keep away from turning it into ridiculous fanservice everywhere. When that scene showed up, I was prepared for the worst, but it ended up turning out for the best.
